comment: She is energetic and funny! I loved performing scenesmonologues because she gave great feedback on how to improve performance. Downside is that you really can't miss more than 2 classes or it drops your grade and it felt like we had 2 written assignments a week on plays (which you have to go pay to see $5-$8) couple extra credit @ end of semester

This class was interesting! I enjoyed it! There was a lot of outside performances that were required, but all were entertaining to me. The final for this class is to perform a play. In a group of classmates, you have to write the play, design costumes, lighting, sound, props, and much more. Her tests are easy if you pay attention.It was fun!

This professor is so annoying which in turn makes the class annoying. I love theater and going to plays but she made it so boring and unbearable. I really hated this class. It is an easy A though... I would try to take Baldwin if she teaches it. Try to take someone who will make this class fun and interesting instead of dull and trite.

Wasn't looking forward 2 this class.she made it pretty interesting.Quizzes are easy,I always took the notes and paid attention.Never studied for the quizzes and made A.Play reports are pretty simple,use lots of examples! She is VERY entergetic and peppy and she does dress cute.She recently had a baby, so ask about her! Definitely recommend her.
She's nice. Not an easy grader though. But it's interesting and fun.
She's a good teacher overall.  Study the notes for the tests.  You attend a lot of plays, but they are enjoyable.  She gives many chances for extra credit. Oh yeah, don't make her angry.

I don't thing she's not as bad as the other people have said. If you talk to her one on one she is really nice and caring. The class is a little boring - I was hoping for more interaction but it is a big class. It's mostly a lecture class with lots of powerpoint notes, yuck. But she is usually happy and funny and she always dresses really nice!!!

Use lots of adjectives on papers, she could care less about facts, just adjectives. Her class is Art, please.....She makes it as difficult as possible. You go to several musicals, plays, festivals, I was bored out of my mind. Numb by the end of term. Good luck

She is great! She tells you EXACTLY what she wants, then the rest is up to you. Be very mushy and detailed in your reports....  Offers 30 extra credit points, which is very easy to obtain. Usher if you can!!!! You have to see the play anyway, so why not get in for free AND get 15 bonus points?!?!?! It's too easy of an oppurtunity to pass up!!!

She was very clear of what she wanted. I don't know if this is how it is for all theatre 1107s, her classes were mostly lecture. Every day: "what did YOU think about this?" Not much interaction with other students, besides the group project. Be VERY afraid of making her mad. Apparently she can be very rude. Her fuse is VERY short. She is scary.
she the worse teacher i ever took. she act like she a english teacher when it come to gradeing papers.

what can I say about professor Reid, lets see where to start.First she puts too much emphasis on the papers that you have to right about the plays that you see. The worst part is she mark so hard on grammatical errors and ignore the entire content of the paper. She is so bad that she corrected my grammar and put the wrong thing. All I heard this se

She was the worst professor this semester.  She was not helpful with any of the reports, especially the first one.  Too much work for an 1107.  If you want to hate theatre after you leave, be sure to take this class.  All I heard all semester was "be more specific".  Honestly
Very specific examples on reports and things... You have to go to like 3 performances for grades.

The professor placed lots on focus on the papers that were due on the plays that we were required to see. The class was a waste of good time and she seemed to be the only one excited about the class. The class didn't have a final exam and only two tests. Attendance is mandatory and she will go out and look for you of you leave early.
